commits.summary: Show tool tip when prettifying JSON fails
commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.body: This was also the behavior prior to last commit.

commits.summary: Drop intermediate ruby code for JSON prettifier
commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.body:
For reasons I didn’t care to learn, the ruby wrapper would stall for large JSON files.

While the command is simply calling the python JSON tool (module) it has a shell shebang as I am not sure what code is required to replicate python’s ‘-m’ switch.

commits.summary: Add indent patterns and smart typing pairs.
commits.author: Michael Sheets

commits.summary: Show the error in a tooltip if the reformatting fails.
commits.author: Martin Ottenwaelter

commits.summary: Show error on older OS versions.
commits.author: Michael Sheets

commits.summary: Improve by using Python to reformat.
commits.author: Michael Sheets

commits.summary: Fixed little grammar bug where the fractional part of a number was required when written in an exponential form (i.e.: a number like 1e10 was considered as invalid and required to be written as 1.0e10).
commits.author: David Bonnet

commits.summary: Switch JSON prettifier to ctrl-shift-h key combination.  Rename to 'Reformat Document / Selection'.
commits.author: Duane Johnson

commits.summary: Add the following keys to the bundle’s info.plist:
commits.author: Allan Odgaard
commits.body:
contactName:
   The full name of the contact for this bundle.
contactEmailRot13:
   A ROT13 encoded email address for the bundle contact (we obfuscate it to avoid spammers from picking up the files, seeing how bundles will often be available via anonymous svn over http).
description:
   A short description for this bundle. Do link to more info about the language (or whatever) the bundle is about. I decided on using HTML for this (but leave out the initial paragraph tag) since it seemed like overkill to run a single line of text through Markdown.pl, just to convert [foo](link) into <a href="link">foo</a>

Many of the current descriptions could use some improvements, I just wanted to get the ball rolling :)


git-svn-id: http://svn.textmate.org/trunk/Bundles/JSON.tmbundle@6718 dfb7d73b-c2ec-0310-8fea-fb051d288c6d

commits.summary: Adding the more complete JSON syntax developed as an example in the TextMate book.
commits.author: James Edward Gray II
